metadata.title: Tell the Environment Agency about your material facility

email.responseTime: Email the Environment Agency if you have any question about materials facility regulations.

metadata.submissionGuidance:
The Environment Agency will process your form and send you a confirmation email within 10 working days.

If you asked for the details of where waste material is sent to be excluded from the public register, we will process this and send you a determination within 20 working days.

draft.name: Tell the Environment Agency about your material facility

pages.title: Summary
Is the site you're notifying or withdrawing a notification for in England?
You cannot use this service

components.name: TbGNwd
components.title: Html
components.content: The site must be in England to use this service. You should contact the environmental regulator for the country where your material facility is based.

pages.title: Notify or withdraw an existing notification

components.name: aZjMHN
components.title: Html
components.content:
You must notify the Environment Agency in writing if you are likely to receive 1,000 tonnes or more of waste material in the next 12 months. You should do this before the end of the reporting period in which you made the assessment.

You may withdraw your notification if you believe that you will receive less than 1,000 tonnes of waste material in the next 12 months.

components.name: lWNdqU
components.title: Do you want to notify the Environment Agency or withdraw an existing notification?

pages.title: Has your assessment concluded your site is likely to receive 1,000 tonnes or more of waste material in the next 12 months?

components.name: nxPoUF
components.title: Over 1,000 tonnes of waste material in 12 months
components.hint: To continue, your assessment must show that your site is likely to receive 1,000 tonnes or more of waste material in the next 12 months.

pages.title: What's the address of the site you're notifying for?
You do not need to notify the  Environment Agency

components.name: fknwhP
components.title: Html
components.content:
You only need to notify the regulator in writing if you are likely to receive 1,000 tonnes or more of waste material in the next 12 months.

Read about waste sampling and reporting from October 2024 (opens in new tab).

pages.title: What's the address of the site you're withdrawing notification for?
What's your name?
What's your email address?
What's your phone number?
What's the name of the permit holder?

components.name: rjzgla
components.title: Permit holder name
components.hint: Provide the details of the operator or the company, individual or organisation who holds the permit.

pages.title: Permit reference number

components.name: jiNCAa
components.title: Html
components.content: You can search the waste opersations register (opens in new tab) if you do not know your Environmental Permitting Regulations (EPR) permit reference number.

components.name: HiLYRx
components.title: What's your EPR permit reference number?
components.hint: Permit reference numbers usually contain 2 letters, 4 numbers and 2 letters, for example, AB1234AB.

pages.title: Public register

components.name: yyBlhM
components.title: Html
components.content:
From 1 October 2024, notified material facilities will need to provide additional information as part of the required reporting. This information will be held on the Environment Agency's public register.

The Environment Agency considers the name, address and date of where output material that leaves the facility is sent may be commercially or industrially confidential information.

components.name: yPOgnx
components.title: Do you consent to including the date, name and address of where output material is sent on the Environment Agency's public register?

pages.title: Why are the destinations for waste material that leaves the site commercially confidential?

components.name: IxloES
components.title: Reason to exclude customer name and address

pages.title: What's your job title?
Are you the main contact for this permitted waste facility?
What's the name of the main contact?
What's the email address of the main contact?
What's the phone number of the main contact?
What other reasons do you have to object to the inclusion of this information on the Environment Agency's public register?

components.name: avcdFO
components.title: Other reason to exclude customer name and address from the public register

pages.title: What's the name of the site you're notifying for?
What's the name of the site you're withdrawing notification for?
In which reporting period will your notification end?

conditions.name: fHLjwC
conditions.displayName: Yes - consent to details added to public register

value.name: Yes - consent to details added to public register

field.name: yPOgnx
field.display: Exclude name and address from public register

conditions.name: wGYZku
conditions.displayName: Yes -main contact and notify - not withdraw

value.name: Yes -main contact and notify - not withdraw

conditions.name: fbJVQi
conditions.displayName: Not notifying on behalf od a permitted waste operation

value.name: Not notifying on behalf od a permitted waste operation

field.name: nxPoUF
field.display: Over 1,000 tonnes of waste material in 12 months

field.name: nxPoUF
field.display: Over 1,000 tonnes of waste material in 12 months

field.name: IxloES
field.display: Reason to exclude customer name and address

lists.title: Reason for excluding from public register
lists.name: gogrxO

items.text: The customer address has an economic value and could cause econmic harm if made available through the public register
items.value: The customer address has an economic value and could cause econmic harm if made available through the public register

items.text: The public interest in maintaining the confidentiality of the name and address of the customer outweighs the public interest of disclosing it through the public register
items.value: The public interest in maintaining the confidentiality of the name and address of the customer outweighs the public interest of disclosing it through the public register
